newsitem.title: USA: C-Cube says Sun Micro to use C-Cube technology.
newsitem.headline: C-Cube says Sun Micro to use C-Cube technology.

text.p: C-Cube Microsystems Inc on Monday said Sun Microsystems Inc will use C-Cube's video encoding technology in its audio/video development for local and wide area communications networks.

The project, being designed by Sun's advanced development group, is developing video communications applications for Intranet and video-on-demand markets that require minimal delay when receiving digital video signals on a network.
C-Cube's encoding technology is based on the MPEG-2 (Motion Picture Entertainment Group) standard.
C-Cube shares were up two to 29-3/8 by midday.

"C-Cube's industry-standard MPEG-2 encoding engines provide a solid foundation for the advanced digital video technologies Sun is exploring," said Greg Popadopoulos, chief technology officer at Sun Microsystems Computer Co.
Separately, C-Cube said it and Adaptec Inc will collaborate on products that allow video professionals and consumers to more easily move between multiple digital video formats.
